intro: Melandrium triflorum var. ajanense, commonly known as the three-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in clusters of three, giving it its common name. This species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
